page.title: 14Burscough-Past Jobs-Canals
page.content: Work on the canals about forty years ago was one of the main sources of employment in Burscough. Get up at 4a.m.Go onto canal boat.Meals eaten on boat include breakfast and dinner.On short journeys you are home for tea.On long journeys you would sleep when the boat was being unloaded and loaded.Some journeys would take up to three weeks.There were many different jobs on the barges including "walking"the barge under bridges by lying on your back and pushing the bridge with your feet.Many different goods were carried including sugar from Liverpool,grain from Burscough mill to Liverpool,coal from Wigan to Liverpool and manure from Liverpool for spreading on the fields by local farmers.
